title: It always rained when Aarav noticed her
text:
It always rained when Aarav noticed her. 

The bus stop was crowded, the sky heavy, and people impatient—but she stood still, holding a pale blue umbrella that didn’t quite match the storm. Her name, he would later learn, was Meera. 

Every evening at 6:40 PM, they shared the same silence.

title: Aarav never spoke
text:
Aarav never spoke. Meera never looked first. Yet something invisible passed between them—like a paused moment that neither wanted to break.

One day, the rain didn’t come.

title: The sky was clear, and Meera wasn’t at the stop
text:
The sky was clear, and Meera wasn’t at the stop. 

Aarav felt something strange—an absence louder than noise. Days passed. No rain.

title: No blue umbrella
text:
No blue umbrella. No her. 

Then, one evening, as the first drops touched the road, he saw her again—this time without the umbrella, hair soaked, smiling as if she had been waiting for the rain just like he had been waiting for her.

“Looks like we both depend on the weather,” she said.
